Explanation: The country code of the project
Is it a regional rail project?
Notes: Regional rail denotes a line running on mainline or mainline-compatible tracks, including commuter rail tunnels and RER and S-Bahn projects

Explanation: The length of the line or phase in kilometers

Notes: Tunnel length and percentage are the most accurate among the tunnel, elevated and at-grade values. Tunnel length information was often retrieved from the same sources as the cost and length information but elevated and at-grade lengths were calculated or derived from Open Street Maps.

Explanation: Length of the section that is elevated
Notes: Tunnel length and percentage are the most accurate among the tunnel, elevated and at-grade values. Tunnel length information was often retrieved from the same sources as the cost and length information but elevated and at-grade lengths were calculated or derived from Open Street Maps.

Explanation: Length of the section that is at grade
Notes: Tunnel length and percentage are the most accurate among the tunnel, elevated and at-grade values. Tunnel length information was often retrieved from the same sources as the cost and length information but elevated and at-grade lengths were calculated or derived from Open Street Maps.

Explanation: The length of platforms in meters
Source type for length, tunnel, station and platform data
Format:
Media
Trade: Specialized industry journals such as railway gazette and railjournal
Plan: Government Document, Wiki
Notes: Trade denotes specialized trade media, distinct from general mass media

For the majority of the entries, costs exclude rolling stock. In a few cases where disaggregated data doesn't exist, it may include rolling stock. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/16GoHcbW-eVzHUUP_XCWVXS1s_i3ZBnmZh4kvdSX7muU/edit?usp=sharing for comments.

Explanation: Year used to adjust cost for PPP and inflation. Often the mid year of construction, unless the Cost value is already adjusted for a given year.
